info.name: Dreamcatcher
info.attribution:
Board layout by ArnoldSmith86 and RaphaelAlvez. Released to public domain under CC0. The library image (and card back) was generated by Midjourney using the prompt "dreamcatcher, water color painting". The background with prompt "subtle brush strokes, water color painting --ar 16:10". All card images were also generated by Midjourney using various prompts.

Texts were generated by ChatGPT and tweaked by ArnoldSmith86.
info.description: Dreamcatcher is a charming game where players navigate ambiguity and clarity with illustrated cards. The goal is to hint at your chosen image subtly enough to guide some, but not all, players to it, earning the most points to win.

info.ruleText:
Objective

Dreamcatcher is a game of creative guesswork. Your goal is to score the most points by subtly hinting at your chosen image, leading most (but not all) players to it.

Setup

  1. Every player joins by clicking on a seat at the top.
  2. Click restart_alt.

Playing the Game

  1. The active player (the "storyteller" with the highlighted seat) looks at their 6 cards at the bottom (every player sees different cards), selects one, and gives a hint about it. This could be a word, a phrase, a sound, or a sentence. They drag the card into a holder in the center.
  2. Everyone else selects a card from their hand that best matches the storyteller's hint and also moves it to the center.
  3. When everyone selected a card, they will automatically be shuffled and revealed, and players (except the storyteller) vote on which card they believe belongs to the storyteller by clicking the check mark on the card.
  4. When all votes are in, they are revealed, and the scoreboard on the left is updated as per the scoring rules (given below).
  5. Click skip_next to start the next round. Your cards will be replenished.

Scoring

  • If all players or no one finds the storyteller's card, the storyteller scores 0, and all other players score 2.
  • If at least one but not all players find the storyteller's card, the storyteller scores 3 points per correct vote, and so do the players who found the storyteller's card.
  • Players also score 1 point for each vote that their submitted cards receive.

Game End

The game ends when the deck is empty or one player scores 30 points. The player with the most points wins.

Have fun playing Dreamcatcher!
